TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void OlkTextBoxEvents_KeyDownEventHandler(ref int KeyCode, OlShiftState Shift);
.class public auto ansi sealed OlkTextBoxEvents_KeyDownEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub OlkTextBoxEvents_KeyDownEventHandler(ByRef KeyCode As Integer, Shift As OlShiftState)
public delegate void OlkTextBoxEvents_KeyDownEventHandler(int % KeyCode, OlShiftState Shift);

Docs.param: The numerical value of the key pressed.
A bitwise-OR mask of constants in the enumeration that specifies whether the SHIFT, CTRL, or ALT keys have been pressed.
Docs.summary: This is a delegate for an event in the corresponding object. After implementing a callback method for the event, use this delegate to connect the callback method to the event. If there are multiple versions of the event interface, this delegate connects the callback method for the event in the specified version of Outlook.
